body.p: The following is an example on how to create a small cluster with a Core node and one DEA.

p.note: For convenience, copy the code blocks and paste them into a text editor. You can edit them there and then copy and paste back into the cf-mgmt tool as necessary. You may also want to refer to the full cf-mgmt tool command reference documentation.

ul.li: The Helion Development Platform must be installed.
The cf-mgmt tool must be downloaded and installed.

ol.li: Download the latest bootstrap.yml and save it in the same folder where the cf-mgmt tool is installed.

Open and configure the bootstrap.yml file to match your environment. Here is an example:constructor-image-name: HP Helion Development Platform - Application Lifecycle Service Installer 1.2.0.282 constructor-flavor: standard.xsmall seed-node-image-name: HP Helion Development Platform - Application Lifecycle Service Seed Node 1.2.0.282 core-flavor: standard.medium cluster-title: <My Cluster Title> cluster-prefix: <My Cluster Prefix> dea-count: 1 dea-flavor: standard.large az: <My Availability Zones>Please ensure the values for image names, image sizes and availability zones ("az") are valid for your current configuration.

Run the following set of commands. cf-mgmt.exe ^ --os-auth-url <OpenStack authentication URL> ^ --os-username <username> ^ --os-password <password> ^ --os-tenant-id <id> ^ --os-tenant-name "<tenant-name>" ^ --os-region-name "<region-name>" ^ create-cluster ^ --keypair-name <keypair name> ^ --admin-email <admin email> ^ --admin-password <admin password> ^ --max-cluster-wait-duration -1 ^ --max-corenode-wait-duration -1 ^ --load bootstrap.yml

section.note: A value of -1 indicates an infinite duration.
